title: Period of SHM - claim about period

content.prompt: A cart of mass m is attached to a horizontal spring with spring constant k and undergoes simple harmonic motion on a horizontal surface with period T. A student claims that quadrupling both the mass and the spring constant will cause the cart to undergo simple harmonic motion with a period of 2T. Is the claim correct? Why or why not?

choices.label: Yes, because the period is proportional to the square root of the mass.
Yes, because the period is proportional to the square root of the ratio mk.
No, because quadrupling the mass and the spring constant will cause the period to quadruple.
No, because the ratio mk will not change if both quantities are quadrupled.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
